creator: jonxl@telia.com
text:
Today "403 Forbidden" is generated when a Method not allowed is received.
(Configured bu using <Limit> or <LimitExcept> Directive)

In RFC2616 there is an error "405 Method Not Allowed" listed.
Error 405 seems more suitable instead of forbidden.

Suggestion: Generate 405 instead of 403 when Method is denied.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
Interesting point, but not quite possible. The problem is, that <Limit> and
mod_access are two different things, i.e. you just limit the directives to some
HTTP methods, but these methods may or may not relate with the actual decision.
